title: gredinger
author: gredinger
created_time: July 14, 2022, 07:33:07 PMLast edit: July 20, 2022, 01:57:35 PM by gredinger
content: [title]Making law extend to make digital monies is just applying wire codes too.edit: forgot an [ing]

comments.author: gredinger
comments.body: You'd think society's response to cryptocurrency fraud would be more than silence in a cryptocurrency community.Guess not.

comments.author: gredinger
comments.body: I suppose I'm allowed a daily bump of this very busy topic.

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: Quote from: gredinger on July 19, 2022, 09:27:36 PMI suppose I'm allowed a daily bump of this very busy topic.The topic makes no sense.  I honestly have no idea what the below means."Making law extend to make digital monies is just apply wire codes too."Clearly that is not a coherent sentence.  Are you asking for a law to be implemented for Bitcoin double spends and saying that they have a law for this applying to wire codes?  I assume by wire codes you mean wire transfers?  Who knows?  You'll have to do a lot better than that for a thread if you want people to discuss something.  No clue what you were trying to do here or why you're bumping it.

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: I think the code somewhat accounts for this by incentivizing double spend attackers to use their efforts for good instead of evil. Andreas Antonopoulos made a pretty good speech about it once upon a time. I’ll link to the video below. One of the early thoughts about Bitcoin was that it could reduce the need for such financial regulation. I’m not sure more laws is something anyone needs. https://youtu.be/ncPyMUfNyVM

comments.author: gredinger
comments.body: Double spending to attack a chain's security is different intent than attacking a chain for wealth manipulation.

comments.author: BADecker
comments.body: The reason for the up and coming money crash is, the whole Federal Reserve Banking system is a big fat Ponzi. If you are really interested, Google "Tom Schauf bank freedom." Then study what you find. It will take more than a minute.
